parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Triggers

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns vehicle attached to the trigger (for example using [[triggerAttachVehicle]]).

<br><br><template><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> The trigger could be [[local]] or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the vehicle attached locally on the client that executed the command. See [[createTrigger]] for more info.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''triggerAttachedVehicle''' trigger

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> trigger: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>return <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''triggerAttachedVehicle''' triggerName;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[attachObject]], [[attachTo]], [[attachedObjects]], [[attachedTo]], [[waypointAttachVehicle]], [[waypointAttachedVehicle]], [[lightAttachObject]], [[triggerAttachVehicle]], [[attachedObject]], [[triggerAttachObject]]
</value></part></template>
